review:
I normally don't post reviews super early for games, but I'm gonna have to jump on the review bomb ship on account of the terrible grind found in the game's unlockable content. Anyway, aside from that here are some early impressions...

Pros: It plays pretty good, character designs are cool, graphics are solid, story was fun

Cons: awful grind, piss poor rewards for playing the game, cosmetic options are locked behind the previously mentioned grind, loading screens make my beefy gaming rig sound like a jet engine, cutscenes run at 30 fps and there are weird graphical issues that make scorpions beard look like a holographic pokemon card

The Variation system suuuuuuucks. It is so confusing and I really don't give a shit about learning how it works. I just want to use the tournament legal/ranked moves. I don't even want to bother customizing a character with different moves if they're banned in competitive play. 

Don't buy it until they sort it out and  hopefully add further pc optimization. This is only an okay port in my experience. I'm running an i7 8700, gtx 1080, and 16 GB of RAM but my computer hates something about the loading screens in this game.

review: The game would of been at least 4 or 5 stars if they didn't pull micro-transactions garbage. Literally we get games that do the same sh!t over and over again. Yet, they don't learn from each other. I don't mind if you have to pay for skins but to make it pay to win in the Towers of Time really made me give this game a 1-2 stars. I've been a fan since the start and you really lost me after I was done the story mode. Like really acid rain that constantly drains my health or these blood missiles that you cannot block and gives the health to the enemy. What is this shit? I really want to love this game but I cannot with this pay to win scheme. I recommend not to buy this game unless they fix this. It's the only way companies stop pulling this selfish garbage. As if paying almost $100 for a game is not enough to get a decent play through.

review: HUGE Mk fan. Have every single game even the questionable experimental ones. Absolutely gutted by this. Its a JOKE. It looks amazing and plays amazing and then they completely honestly ruin it with propaganda, forced grinding gameplay, insane difficulty. I wish they would admit what its all about. They want microtransactions for everything or a million hours playing against unbeatable AI. They removed womens boob type clothing (i dont care seriously) but they said its because u wouldnt show that skin in a fight but yet the men do.? Admit your propaganda and pandering Ed Boon, Netherealm, Warner Bros. I feel like some Social Justice warriors made the decisions here. Im so sickened that they got a full days pay off me. I dont have this type of money to waste and waste it I did. I feel like I have a free to play game that costs a fortune to win. Terrible terrible decision. Im out Ed.

review: I can accept micro transactions that are reasonable (even though I disagree with this business model) however the micro transactions in this game are far from reasonable. $5 for a character skin and to purchase everything comes to over $6000, how ridiculous. I would rather buy a car and drive it into a tree than to pay this amount of money on one video game. I understand that you do not have to spend money to obtain these items as they are obtainable through game play however the  time investment needed is too unrealistic. It is surprising how stupid some business's decisions can be, thinking people would not realise this and not become unhappy from it. I would highly recommend for people to not purchase this game unless some serious changes are made. The game has other problems but this one is my main gripe. I had previously trusted Ed Boon and NetherRealm, this trust has now been lost. Companies need to understand that it is much more difficult to gain trust than it is to lose it. I will not be purchasing any DLC or future games from this company until changes are made.

review:
I'm done. I'm devastated. I waited for almost a week for things to get better. For all this time I was grinding and grinding and grinding. I never got a skin I was hunting for. And finally I got a key to the tower where was a nice, good-looking skin. And what? Blocked by modifiers. I was almost crying when I was dying and dying and dying without being hit by an AI opponent. And that is 6 freaking days after a game being released. No patches. No community service. Nothing.

And all this politics and SJW in the game. Favorite female characters destroyed. I said to myself - Ok. At least they havent ruined male characters. I can play with them. I closed my eyes to everything, that they ruined. But showing no support to players that are struggling with all this nonsense in creepy mode called - Towers of Time. That just ****. This game is not gamers friendly. The company is not gamers friendly. They are all about politics and taking your money with microtransactions.

P.S. And in social media they are treating people like horse s**t. This is worse then EA.

review:
This game is one of the worst ports to date.

The game crashes NON STOP on Fullscreen, forcing you to play Borderless, which gives you at best 40fps, with massive stutters when stage events happen (for exemple the blood wave splashing against the rocks in the Sea of Blood stage)

I thought the era of shit fighting game ports was over, with Tekken 7 and DBFZ being major hits and having near perfect ports, but apparently not.

Do not buy this on PC, I have 5hours, 3 of these were me playing Borderless out of love for the franchise, the 2 others were me trying to find out what the fuck is wrong with the game before giving up.

What a mess.

review:
While the game is fun to play to a point and if your looking for a Fighter I would just play X. 
During combat, attacks would not register like Upper Cuts and combos. Combat looked and felt clunky at time not feeling smooth at all. distance for basic attacks like punches and kick that should normally land miss. It seem the only time NPC's were better is when they seem to be fighting smoother then I was

In the time I have played so far It has crash 2 different time while playing. The story was ok at best with me wondering where other Characters from 10 were at for 11 that play a big part of the story. They even mention the fights during the story mode as if they were just wipe off the face of the game. Also the fact that some characters will be in one cut seen fighting in a large group battle while in the next seen fighting for the other side as a oversight. On top of that for some reason playing the story I got a  headaches Some thing about the cut seen's were off as if they were not flowing right almost like little stuttering you see it worst when the end credits were rolling by. For some reason also sometime I think the graphics are not fully Rendering in the Crypt area or im hoping its not fully become texture where bad.

review: I'll start by saying im not a fan of X-Ray moves. They slow the game down, and drain half of your health, while requiring little to no real skill to pull off. Plus when you activate one, you drop to 30fps. 30fps in cutscenes. 3 mobile game quality currencies. Ridiculous AI. I mean ridiculous, the AI will literally zone you, or pull off perfect counters or combo breakers. Characters facial hair materializes, and dematerializes, like its some kind of ghost beard. The game just looks blurry, and thats not just the 30fps forced scenes. Lots of characters are missing, cant wait for them to come out as paid DLC...especially since youd already have to pay over $6,500 to own everything, if you choose to bypass the insanely difficult towers and grind in the RNG Krypt anyway.

review:
So. First things first. The gameplay of MK 11 feels like a twosteps forward one step back from MK 10. combo's feel easier overall, though most require that you enhance a special move to not end the string after a single hit string to special, which is... alright i guess.

My big gripe, as is many reviewers, is the micro transactions. for a full price game on release to attempt to extract more money through a randomized lootbox system and in game consumables is extremely disheartening. The fact that on release the main way to get customization pieces (the Towers of Time) are not dictated entirely by player skill, but by having the correct immunity consumable causes those of us with less than legendary abillity at the game to want to drop the game entirely.

Ending statement: The game is good, but the monetization practice of Nether Realm Studios/ Warner Bros. should be criticized much in the same way that EA's Starwars Battlefield was. It is unnacceptable and appalling.

4/30 Update: NRS, if you bother looking at reviews, I hope that more reviewers than I let you know that 3 hearts per fatality is still not a good reward if you need 250 hearts per chest, you need to do 87 fatals per chest. Kind of absurd don't you think? in addition, the towers of time gimmicks still suck. You've put two patches through and it is still absolute agony to attempt to make it through a single tower island in my daily play time. Reduce tower enemies to player hp, or get rid of their gimmicks that force the player to relinquish control of the match, High HP pools and forced breaks in offensive pressure make the game tedious in the extreme.

review:
MK11 is okay, but I do not recommend it in its current form. The normal gameplay and graphics are really good. Story is well done.  Online multiplayer has run well so far.  
    Positives aside, the game has some negatives. Some minor ones? The voice acting of Rhonda Rousey is indeed bad, when compared to the other voice actors in game. Gameplay is too similar to MKX, making it not feel new at all. All these issues can be dealt with, but what can't be is the Towers of TIme, a major game mode that is played to unlock items and for those who enjoy solo play or practice against CPU. That and microtransactions, which are looking to be excessive.
   The Towers of TIme are simply a grind, with many advantages given to the CPU opponent that are many times unbeatable unless the player cheeses a victory. It makes achieving victory through normal gameplay nigh impossible, forcing players to cheese out wins or use the AI to control the player. Basically undoes the point of playing a game.  The developer has received many complaints about this, and have said it will be fixed, but until then, don't buy it if you have any interest in solo gameplay.

review:
I am a big Mortal Kombat fan and as a fan i trusted the folks at NetherRealm Studios (BIG MISTAKE)
some of the mistakes i made are as follows .
.
1) Bought The Premium Edition :- only 7 extra **** skins wear given to premium edition owners , just the basic costume with colour change , NO coins , NO extra stupid currencies , NO backgrounds , NOTHING PREMIUM whatsoever (Robbed us)

2) Played The BETA :- Beta fooled us all , showed us the content is unlocked and in final game even less **** was given (fooled us)

3) Thought there are NO Lootboxes :- Krypt is a **** lootbox itself , every treasure has RNG , and even they can be reopened again and again , so they are the **** lootboxes . (Lied to us)

4) Thought devs respect the fans :- Grindy and rewardless Gameplay (Slap on the face)

5) Devs wont mess with our beloved MK :- ohhh yes they did , ruined the reward and experience with rewardless plays , added 4 diffrent types of currency , time of towers was **** , consumables are pathetic , krypt RNG is crap , and Majority of game content is locked behind paywall .

LONG STORY SHORT ;- They messed upp long time , i feel robbed and fooled . Non of the fans are happy . Because of all the things i mentioned above i wont talk about actual game and story . no matter how good the actual game is , but these pathetic practices have cost them a lot , fans are angry , its gonna be a rough path ahead for NetherRelms if they keep messing with fans

review:
Cannot recommend this game on PC in its current state as it has been revealed the PC (and Switch) versions of this game are several builds behind the console editions, which most importantly affects frame-data and combos so you can be spending hours learning incorrect combos.

If you are currently debating which platform to get this game on, as it stands PS4 and Xbox are your best choices.

Hopefully this issue gets cleared up soon...

review:
Spent 15 hours in the game going through towers, story, and some personal training to try and 'git gud' before jumping into ranked only to find out you can't use custom variations in ranked.  Why the fuck not?  The game is balanced around all these moves anyways.  So now my options are that I either can't play the characters the way I want or I just don't play ranked at all.

Both options are ridiculous and ruins one of the main reasons I was going to even play the damn game.  Also, take this bullshit time-based bottom of the barrel cell phone game mechanics out.  It's like you guys are deliberately trying to piss players off.

review:
Pros:
-The Graphics

Cons:
-You have to have internet access to play a good 75% of the game, you can't even unlock items without the internet.
-Towers of Time are ridiculous
-Items in the Krypt are entirely random. Meaning you may need to open 600 chests, beat the story mode, beat a bunch of Towers of Time before you find the one item you are looking for.
-Microtransactions.

review: Like many others that I see on these reviews I also created this account just to leave this feedback.  I was hype for MK11 and work in a position where I am constantly talking to customers about what games they may like, needless to say I had shared my excitement with them about MK11.  While there are good aspects about this game such as the pure 1v1 fighting and the story mode, I feel that after completing the story moving to the Towers of Time will ruin your experience.  I am not a pro player by far but at least let me loose to an opponent and not a laser from off screen, or a fireball, or another fighter running through etc etc.  Does anyone actually think this is FUN ?  and what pops up on the screen when you lose these fights ? SKIP FIGHT WITH A TOKEN... WTF ?  Congrats you made a game that acknowledges that I won't want to play the actual game parts.   I will suggest that if you want to play mortal kombat rent this game for the story mode then buy MKX or go back and play MK9 for the tower mode.  Very very disappointed.

review:
Remove the "quit" option from online 1v1 matches and then I'll change my recommend. Right before I win they quit. Every, single, game. You don't get a win for it and they don't get a loss (in ranked match, they get a loss in kasual still). Win/Loss is distorted, you never get to do FATALITIES which means you never get hearts, or any other rewards for finishing a match, and basically ruins the Mortal Kombat experience.

I thought QUITALITY was making a return but it never does it. It says "game has desynced". I ONLY get this message right before I win the second match even with both players at good connection so it's obvious a quitter.  I don't see why quitting is even allowed, matches last 5 minutes and kompetitive is at most 15. Any other competitive modes in online games usually gives penalties.

Game is great besides this and would recommend it. But I mainly play online because I like playing humans so quitting with no consequences completely ruins the experience for me.

I don't have a problem with the micro-transactions that don't alter gameplay. All real money does is speed the cosmetics process up, why do people care if other people want to spend money to speed the process up?? I am however super pissed Frost was sold for 6$ when you get her for free in the story mode......... I bought the premium edition of the game and straight up thought they forgot to add Frost. Yeah, I got reamed real good for that.

DO NOT BUY UNTIL THEY FIX THIS!

review: Not only does the game have an absolutely broken Krypt and Tower of Time system (that they said they WOULD fix) the port itself is also very dodgy. Even on max setting this game looks pretty poor, almost like they accidentally ported the switch version by accident. The texture quality is very dodgy and the AA and hair effects look absolutely dreadful. It is VERY distracting to look at, especially when playing story mode when the cut scenes transition to the gameplay, it's absolute night and day. Even the performance is on and off for me as well. For the most part, it does run relatively smooth, but the Krypt and Fatal Blows are locked at 30 fps? WTF?!?! Also, I have some stuttering issues as well, but that doesn't happen as often. Absolutely terrible. NRS, fix the gameplay issues and whoever the hell ported this, fix this travesty as well. Cannot recommend at the moment.

review:
Normally don't write reviews, but jeez this game is in a horrid state. Lack of support from developers and as of this writing, the day 1 patch hasn't even been implemented yet. Story is fine and so are the graphics, but that's pretty much where the pros end. 

The Towers are unreasonably difficult. I don't expect rewards to be handed out like candy, but it's ridiculous when you have modifiers that are constantly spamming you every few seconds. The rewards from the various game modes are lackluster to say this least. The developers announced a patch to remedy this, but it might not get to PC the same time as consoles with the way the support has been going. Abysmal support and lack of response from the development team. Dumpster fire and hot garbage sum up the way the game is on PC in its current state.
review_bomb_reason: Das Spiel erhielt zu Release sehr viele negative Bewertungen, unter anderem aufgrund der von den Entwicklern "Netherrealm Studios" angeblich eingebauten "Social Justice Warrior / SJW - Propaganda" und politischen Agenda (weil in einem der Enden des Spiels ein dunkelhäutiger Charakter in die Vergangenheit reist, um die Sklaverei abzuschaffen), vielen Mikrotransaktionen und dem Fehlen von beliebten Charakteren aus früheren Teilen der Serie.

review:
Imagine a mobile game. Now imagine that every single thing you're able to do and unlock in that mobile game was purposefully made to be grindy as humanly possible so that people will have that small temptation in the back of their mind to purchase in-game currency to save them from the hell that awaits. Now imagine the mobile game is called Mortal Kombat 11.

Right now, don't get this game at full price. The combat is deep and there is a lot of content, but it's overshadowed by the disgusting in-game microtransaction practices that weren't revealed until release day. 2019 baby

EDIT: After playing around 50 hours during this edit, I can safely say to all potential buyers DO NOT GET THE PC VERSION. There is no communication with the pc community. It is 4/29/2019 and pc still doesn't have the DAY 1 PATCH. It almost feels like they're intentionally ignoring everything pc related and only give "soon" as an excuse. There was also a 60 FPS mod that was created by a player to fix ultrawide scaling and make krushing blows, fatal blows, fatalities, and the menus 60 FPS to make the game graphically consistent, but it now seems that utilizing the mod is punishable which makes no sense. The game's engine isn't affected by the mod and you aren't given any advantage but a ban is possible. horrible

As for microtransaction practices, I might have spoken too soon for that. It's not expensive in the way you think. It's expensive time-wise. There is so much grinding that it's better to use an ai with a turbo controller if you have one. Even then, you can't have the ai go forever since you'll eventually need to reselect the game modes after your ai dies.

Just don't get the game. If you can get it $40 or less, maybe. Even after that price, don't expect developer cooperation because they won't give you the time.

Good game NetherRealm Studios, good job Boon.

review:
This is a great game if you are new to fighting games and want to dip your toe in, but as you inevitably get better you might find yourself getting bored fast.

I'm only rating the fighting, just bought the game and am gonna return it, I have no knowledge on any of the other issues. Fighting is probably the slowest I have experienced in awhile, you can telegraph and stun lock opponents pretty quickly because it costs them energy to react quickly using the technique "stand up fast." Fatalities are great (Kassie's heart fatality is the best, fight me) but it feels more like a chore to get to them because the fighting feels bland compared to mk9. I'm probably gonna return the game. Im sure the story mode is great but it says I can't play it for another 4 hours and I don't think I'll enjoy chugging through these fights just to see a story that will be readily available on youtube. It's a shame because I know they worked hard on it, but the gameplay itself isn't rewarding enough for me, sorry. Again if you are new to fighting games, great game to start with because things are slow, but they did take away the ability to chain different kombos so you might have to look at the fighting instructions if you want to land multiple hits.

review: Played through the original borderlands years ago and have been running through GOTY Enhanced with some friends this week.  As it stands right now, co-op has a lot of issues.  There's a tremendous amount of lag going on.  The host doesn't seem to be impacted as much, but mobs are teleporting all over which makes it hard to aim.  There are also frequent game crashes, and a lot of the game options are reset back to default when you start the game as well, which means we can't disable voice without messing around with the config.  We've decided to wait until everything is patched before continuing the playthrough.

review:
I really didn't like this game at all. Almost all the npcs were downright annoying and boring. The only playable character that even looked interesting to me was Claptrap and one of his special abilities(Rubber Duck) is one of the most irritating things I have seen in gaming. The side missions are extremely tedious with lots of back and forth with no excitement in playing any of them again IF i decide to play true vault hunter mode and ultimate. I'm gobsmacked at how they can come from a masterpiece like borderlands 2 and end up with this pale comparison. I have not bothered trying the DLC yet... if its anything like the campaign then ill be passing on it.

EDIT: after playing the only released DLC i can honestly say this is in my top 5 for worst games ever played. The DLC was absolutely horrible in every way shape or form. I will never buy another gearbox game again

review:
I will admit, this game can be enjoyable to play (Borderlands 2 is more enjoyable anyways).

But, Gearbox has shown that they do not care about us. Their exclusivity deal with Epic Games and certain employees victim blaming responses to fans negativity have shown they are not a dev team that deserves money and respect. They would rather push our worries aside while making fun of us to their loyal fans. There is no way Gearbox had no say in this exclusivity deal. Even if they didn't, they seem to be very happy with it. If you can resist the urge to buy this game, please do so.

review:
Currently i would say if you plan on playing this with friends,DON'T. There are quite a few bugs that make this unplayable.
-Unable to actually mute your in game voice so you have to do it manually everytime you join a game.
-Unable to play with more than 60fps (me and my 2 friends that i was trying to play with were unable to use our 144hz monitors).
-Worst of all the lag that makes it so unplayable at times that only the host can do anything (all 3 of us have good enough internet to stream so we shouldn't be having any issues).
With these issues the quality of life in co-op is just absolute garbage and until they fix it i'd say stick with Borderlands 2.

review:
Look the game itself is alright. I sunk 11 hours into this last night and prior to that got bored after an hour but i wasn't in the mood to play it back then.

Wouldn't have played 11 hours straight almost if it was trash. HOWEVER. MY FUCKING SAVE GOT DELETED!!!!!

I cannot override my old save, i cannot delete my old save, i cannot make a new save. The games fucked and this bug should NEVER have made it to launch.

EDIT: After some trial and error, turns out my antivirus, Bitdefender, had blocked borderlands from saving to the folder as it was classed as a 'protected' folder. Upon allowing the game was successfully saved. However, my save was not restored by the game, it *mysteriously came back*. This does still happen to people (i assume) without bitdefender. So, while i am enjoying the game, there is a risk that your save may just decide to fuck off one day.

6/10


*Thanks github

review:
pro:
* doesnt revolve around slag
* laser weapons are fun
* moon movement with O2 jet is fun

con:
* quests doesnt flow into each other very well
* side quests are boring
* writing/dialog ranges from annoying to borderline annoying
* characters are fucking terrible, especially fuck that anakin kid
* very few enemy types. been fighting the same AI over and over again. borderlands 2 was fun because it is chaotic, you are getting bombarded from multiple angles by AIs that all want to do different stuff
* atmosphere is unmemorable but yet so giant, making huge areas of nothing
* a lot more bugs (jack getting stuck on a quest npc's body so he cannot get on elevator and a few quest givers wont talk to you unless you quit to main menu)

tldr: play borderlands 2 instead

review: Got this free because I owned the original game. Most bugs have been unpatched. Remaster is barely noticeable, and the golden key chest craps out legendaries like there's no tomorrow. I have about 10 level variants of the new legendary combat rifle. Minimap was a nice idea. Makes the game easier to navigate, and lets you see when some bandit is trying to get the drop on you. Hud's more colorful. Menus are worse. Whoever the genius was who made it so you hit the bottom of the list and pop back to the top should be fired. Out of a cannon. You have to carefully and purposefully navigate the menus. If you're new to the series. sure, whatever. Pick it up. Fun with friends, kind of a slog alone. Old time player, not much has changed. Bugs remain unpatched. Some enemies literally remain unkillable. Claptrap still T-poses at everybody. Grind for some achievements is still absolutely ludicrous. Is it worth 32.99$ CAD? I guess. It includes the DLCs. I'd still wait for a sale, see if you can get it cheaper.

review:
Finished my first play through. Some thoughts...

There seems to be a memory leak or something the games drops from 200 fps to 30 after a couple of hours of playtime requiring a restart to fix.

The aim was kinda wonky. I had to play it like CS:GO and drag my aim down. Might be auto aim though I have the option disabled.

I get stuck on terrain quite often like trying walk up stairs I just spaz out on the spot and don't move until I move back or jump.

The addition of the mini map is nice and the 4K graphics are appreciated but all in all I can't recommend the game in it's current state.

review:
Go fk yourself，2k



For those who say go to twitter to complain，it won't work. If twitter works，BL3 would not be on Epic the first place. review:
Compared to previous Borderlands titles, this one was significantly less fun, mostly due to the ease of being knocked off the world and killed. there are so many more islands, cliffs and misleading way points to get to a location that i died at least 10x more times than Borderlands 2, cash was never an issue, and there was plenty of boxes to loot for ammo. but constantly having to back track because a random nade or pup knocked me off the map irritated me to no end, it's not a bad mechanic for open spaces, with walls and barricades that prevent you from falling off the world, but when you are on a island 90% of the time where you can be knocked off quite easily....
I purchased this game on sale and played through it once, it was as much as i could stand due to the poor game play.
The story is pretty good and on par with previous titles, and really the only saving grace this game had to hole me to play to the end. I didn't buy this game initially because it's mostly about handsome jack, and i really hated him in borderlands 2, but after playing all the way through pre-sequel i understand why he is so hated, and i still hate him and perhaps even more. but the love hate relationship of claptrap is now a little less hate, even though he is still quite annoying at times.
If you decide to get this game, it is for the story, not the game play, because i could only take small doses of being tossed off the map before i would quit the game in frustration.

review:
Not bad, adds a new spin to the game, but its riddled with many problems, the biggest of which are below.

1: There are points where the game just chugs in terms of framerate. It'll do just fine, 60FPS smooth as silk, then it shits the bed and struggles to make 30. This is at 1080p, and the same rig is capable of playing BL2 maxed out with minimal framedrops. Its definitely not a GPU bottleneck, the chugging part can get so bad my GPU drops into the low power low clocks idle state while a single CPU thread is maxed out.

2: Netcode needs an overhaul, as there's lag everywhere. Hit registration doesn't even work half the time; its a fine thing to be downed and unloading a Double Stinger SMG almost point blank into a Badass Psycho (not a small target by any means) and have half the shots simply phase through it even when said weapon is more than capable of bringing said enemy down. Sniping is a gamble, as even with a 97 acc weapon and the crosshairs dead center on the target's head while standing just outside of their aggro radius the shot has about a 50/50 chance of doing nothing other than alerting the whole area there's a vault hunter to kill.

3: Memory hog: the game uses a shitload of memory and the slow memory leak ensures it gets worse as time goes on. I've had sessions be forced to an end because BL:GOTYE was using 6 of my rig's 8GB (with the other 2 being juggled between the OS and other programs), and every couple of minutes or so its ever increasing pool of used memory would force another couple hundred MB of data out of ram onto the page file. Eventually the page-file fills up, and something crashes due to out of memory. This is absolutely unacceptable.

If you've got the game for free as I did from owning the original copy, its kinda worth a play through, but if you're looking to buy separately, dont.

If you are able to download the update for free because of having borderlands goty previously i do urge you to do so, but for the 30 dollar price tag, look at g2a for cheap steam keys and do not spend the 30 dollars on a game that isnt fully remastered. review:
Seeing this game remastered has been a blessing and a curse for me. The remaster experience has gone well, but I want to list a few gripes as to why I can't recommend this game right now in it's current state.

In this remaster you'll see many different things, but here's some stuff I noticed.

Positives:
-6 new legendary "gearbox" manufacturer weapons, which can be obtained from the golden chest or a very rare boss drop.
-New textures, new color for the experience bar, and the outlining for everything is smoother now.
-Favorite and trash system integrated from Borderlands 2 (which is a very nice addition)
-Lock on for vehicle weaponry.

Negatives:
-The performance would get *extremely* inconsistent and laggy, I'm referring to having 15-20 frames per second or less. It mostly only happens when I tab out or occasionally quit the game and load back in, but the frame loss stays after it starts. Now normally this wouldn't be an issue, however I'm using an RTX 2080, 32 GB of ram, and i7-9700k processor with current drivers and I've even closed all other tabs and programs running...but the problem persists. It wasn't a big enough issue for me to not play all the way through the game (like I did back when I played on xbox360), but I did not want to do a second playthrough or the dlc. If this gets patched, I'll amend my review.
-I noticed some loading screens aren't up to date. A minor issue, but it's things like that which get glossed over and you would expect would be in a remaster. (I.E. the rarity loading screen) It mentions rarity from white to orange, but excludes pearls.
-A lot of legacy exploits still exist, which makes me wonder if some of these bosses were meant to be fought this way. It's a minor thing really, mostly up to personal taste... but I feel like this could've been an opportunity to polish old bosses and make them worth fighting them over again. I don't want to fight them as if I'm still living in 2009 (which I didn't, I'm just using this example). Maybe it's too minor, but I thought I should mention it.

review:
This review is pretty much a copy/paste from my BL2 review...because sadly the SAME EXACT SH*T APPLIES TO THIS GAME...with that said, here ya go:

Runs like utter sh*te. Seriously. If you want to play at anything over 60fps, and have the hardware to do it in most games, don't even bother with this pile of trash. No matter the settings or tweaks, this WILL drop as low as 60fps on a system like mine; a 9900K, 2080Ti & 32GB of 3000Mhz DDR4 system mind you...even on all low at 1440p it runs like this. No rhyme or reason. It's unoptimized garbage. Real shame too, because the gameplay is decent and a lot of fun could be had if it was a smooth experience, especially with friends. 

Oh, one last thing...the devs and publishers are money grubbing scum that care more about making a extra buck than giving their community a good experience.

review:
As many others have pointed out, the use of the Epic Game Store for Borderlands 3 has assured I won't be buying BL3 on release or her on Steam when available. While I have no issue with other competitive services rivaling Steam, I am appalled by Epic Store's practice of no account security, poor feature availability such as an extensive review system/forums/etc., and their use of guaranteed sales quotas and exclusivity  contracts in lieu of creating an actually good service. This does not begin to mention data privacy concerns as well as their blatant disrespect of their customers, the consumers, with their statements made in board and shareholder meetings.

I encourage others that want to end this practice not only to not purchase this game on the Epic Store, but to avoid doing so on Steam following the end of exclusivity. Doing so only proves that the deal was good, as they "double dip" on the better value at Epic Store and appease those here at Steam. Vote with your wallet, folks.

FIX FOR MULTIPLAYER:
Co-op Lag Fix Borderlands GOTY Enhanced
Navigate to Documents\My Games\Borderlands Game of the Year\WillowGame\Config

Open up the WillowEngine.ini
Find bHasVoiceEnabled=True and change it to bHasVoiceEnabled=False
Save and close the file. Go to the properties and mark as read-only.
To run the game, locate the .exe in the root folder from Config and run the game straight from the .exe.

review:
I like 2k games such as the darkness 2 and the bioshock series. In this you die way too easily. your ammo depletes too quickly and when you kill most enemies at least in the snow level as i got near the elevator before i had enough of how bad this game is. You almost never get ammo from dead enemies. Why is there even an ammo store and a gun store? What can they not sell the same thing? I know there's an RPG element to it so I should not be a terminator right away but even if you're say level 5 and you fight a level 5 enemy it's not as balanced as it should be compared to other 2K first person shooters such as bioshock 2 where if you're in say the amusement park all the enemies are so strong and then you go to the next level and they are just a bit stronger but still challenging, there is usually not enough time to jump sideways or so to dodge those big snow balls so you've got to just keep taking hits and it's sickening how fast your health can deplete. I should not have to die every 5 minutes to level up to beat this game where i have to be level say 6 to beat a level 5 enemy.

The robot is extremely annoying and i laughed once, trevor in gta 5 for example is funny because he doesn't try. This is like a 3rd grader trying to be funny beside you during an entire adventure. 

what I didn't like is you've got to meet the person to collect rewards like some stupid bounty hunter instead of just glowing letters "mission complete" or some crap where the XP is wired to your profile but no say I go to that british guy do a task or two i got to go see him again.. come on. They give you this stupid warping to other worlds thing way too quickly and instead of locking the high leveled ones away which is common sense you just walk in with no warning and woosh dead for the 99th time. With my luck the first place i went to as it was closest and it made the most sense everyone was level 30/31. I really was excited and tried to play this with a clear head but this game is trash. Luckily I got a refund.

review:
Reasons not to use Epic Store:
1) They have terrible security, 80 million accounts were exposed last week
2) They have terrible customer service
3) Games are more expensive on the Epic store due to regional pricing
4) You can't play games offline
5) Limited social features
6) No screenshot support
7) No controller support
8) They broke EU laws 
9) You have to tick a box to opt out of emails
10) They are partially owned by Tencent, a company that sells user data to the Chinese government
11) No achievements
12) No cloud saves
13) No game forums
14) They make you pay the transaction fee when purchasing games separate from tax
15) They pay for exclusive rights to games to try and force you to use their store
16) They can refuse refunds even if you meet the criteria
17) No reviews
18) No Linux support

All this alone should let everyone know about the current situation with Borderlands and Take-Two Interactive.

review:
This game is great, when you're playing by yourself. However, I have a group of friends trying to play this game online, and we can't play it legitimately because the online is completely broken. The game lags like crazy, especially in The Dahl Headlands. 
The positives to this game are:
- The graphics
- The smoothness
- Some added features
The Cons however are:
- Online is mostly unplayable
- Frame rate issues in a lot of areas
- Lag beyond control

It's a great upgrade, especially for free. However, I feel as though it should not have been released until everything was properly checked. Will change my review when all these issues are corrected.

review:
Prefacing by saying that I am not here to review bomb, and I've played around 20 hours when my internet was out. I'll probably play a little more to see if it ever smooths out, but so far my experience has not been a pleasant one compared to just modding the original.

The good :

-Slight improvement to graphics
-Money and ammo now auto picks up
-Can now lock guns so  that a window pops up when you try to sell as well as mark others as junk so you can quickly sell what you don't want
-Updated GUI
-decent performance fps wise

The bad : 

Putting this game in the new engine causes a lot of issues with the terrain that range from annoying to practically unplayable at parts because you can get stuck in walls and the floor. Example : you go to duck out of a fight only to find you can't duck because you're caught in/on the wall/floor/bush/dead enemy. another example of this is when you go to duck on cover and the enemies get stuck in an animation loop on a piece of scenery. It makes a fight that otherwise is intense turn into just stopping to laugh at the skag stuck in the scenery. 

Another example of the new engine ruining things: 
Driving along in the car with the boost on, there's a tiny pebble in the road. your whole car completely stops as if you just hit a brick wall. Fine, we'll avoid that spot by jumping this cliff after backing up. Oh look, the edge of a cliff also had an invisible wall and stole all your speed for the jump and now you died when you could have just ramped to the other cliff and been fine in the normal game.

This is an "I've heard" but haven't done for myself because I USUALLY do borderlands single player, but apparently the multiplayer is bugged all to hell with lag and desyncs galore.


TL;DR, Conclusion:

Just mod the original to look roughly the same or better than the enhanced version, without all the annoying scenery/engine glitches and deal with it taking just a few seconds longer to sell and pick up items.

review:
Unlike my recent spite filled review of Borderlands 2 on account of the Epic Games store conundrum, I do have an actual complaint. As of right now (April 5th, 2019) there are audio files that bear heavy compression artifacts, and that is something that would normally make me return the game on account of a massive headache (I was given a copy for free via the Handsome Collection). That being said, the game has been fun, and while the movement and gunplay seem a bit clunky, it still offers a fun experience. I only wish they would spruce up the audio in pre-rendered cutscenes, as that's where it appears to be at it's worst.

Fix that one little bit Gearbox, and I might flip the negative to a positive.

review:
Doesn't stack up to the first two.  I played it with some friends and it wasn't torturous..  But if you haven't played any borderlands and are thinking the newest is probably the best.  It is not.  If you have played the other games and are wanting more... you won't quite get it.

It is sadly just a forgettable game.  I don't even remember what character I played as.  Whereas I remember exactly what characters I played through 1 & 2 with, and what builds I went with, and what cool loot I got that fit my characters.

Lastly playing for the lore aspect of it has some value, but given the recent decisions and interactions of the the team, I don't have any faith that getting invested in the universe is going to pay off for you in the future.

review:
Borderlands is for me the most overrated game series in recent history. These games are just mediocore shooters. This game has tons of problems and even more in newer remastered edition. There is no story, unbalanced combat, and even no humor, which is main reason why a lot of people love Borderlands. I bought all three games in huge expectations, because from videos it looks like a ton of fun and i loved it already. I read many times that it is a lot better playing solo to enjoy the characters, story etc, which was another reason why I jumped in this series. But all of the games are so messy, boring, funny jokes are only in trailers, stupid enemies, stupid game mechanics and I can talk about other reasons why I was totally surprised how bad these games are.
5/10 only because I have some hope that it is a little fun in more players and for some small originality

review:
to all those people ♥♥♥♥♥ing about the review bombing...

2k has shown that it clearly does NOT care about the consumers by making borderlands 3 exclusive to the epic games launcher for a limited time, despite the epic games store being universally hated by the pc gaming community. why? because they were paid to do so. this is a huge middle finger to the steam community, and may even harm the pc gaming industry in the long run. epic pays devs/publishers huge sums of money to get their games to be exclusive to their ♥♥♥♥♥♥ platform for a limited time, which means that even if the game fails, they still profit from the sheer amount of money epic paid them before they even launched the game. because of this, they could easily say "what's the point of making a high quality product if we profit off of it anyway?" thus leaving us with a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game even AFTER we wait for it to come to steam.

the pc gaming community is not a group of people that let themselves get pushed around like ragdolls. no, if you push us around, we will push BACK in any way we can, and epic, as well as anyone partnering with them for timed exclusives, are going to learn this the hard way.

review:
After spending tons and tons of time and making many friends in this game I'm going to have to say that you shouldn't buy it. 
Reason being is that the company producing the next game in the saga decided that an exclusivity deal with a company that is frankly terrible with terrible business practices will have their next game on their launcher *cough cough* Epic. They're basically spitting in the face of long time players of their game. There's nothing that Epic offers that steam doesn't in fact they offer less. Gearbox doesn't deserve your time or money. There are plenty more shooter type games from other indie developers that would be worth your money. They've gone down the route of greed. One of the developers of the original borderlands on twitter is acting like a total asshole too. So that's pretty much how he's going to treat your feedback of the game.

review:
Gearbox isn't just making bad business decisions nowadays. But also bad work.
This is the piss poorest port of all time.
As someone said here....this game should be called Borderlands:  The Slideshow edition.
This is the best example of: "just because it is free, doesn't meant in's good"
New bugs all over the place, game crashes, over and over again. After playing an hour, virtual memory overflooding and game needs to be restarted, minimap bugs and objective markers bugged. The list is endless.

Played the game   with friends back when it came out till our eyes begun to bleed. Playing this with the same friends, and it's more of a pain in the a** than enjoyment.

review:
A real disappointment after the second game, which in my opinion wasn't as good as the first one. I had to really struggle to finish it the first time. I impulse bought all the DLC and haven't played any of them yet. I'll probably finish them eventually, but I am a super fan. If you are a super fan you probably had this game already. If you are wondering what this whole borderlands thing is about, the second one is probably the most approachable, while the first one is the best imo.

Its a shame too, because the class design was much more interesting and diverse than other games, but the level design, writing, quest design and plot points are a chore to get through, Most of my playtime has been getting each class up enough to try out some interesting builds. It wasn't worth the effort.

review:
Just thought I would do my first review bomb in response to Steams decision to silence its own customers through 'curation' of the reviews.
Ironically Steam is shutting down reviews for a game thats sequel is coming exclusively to another platform, so now people are review bombing this game (its predecessor) in protest, which Steam in turn is censoring to please the same publisher that isnt releasing thier new game here. You cant make this stuff up!

I myself am review bombing this game as both a test to Steams new system and in general protest to Steams new system. 

As far as what others are review bombing this game for, I completely disagree with them. I dont use Epic Games, but maybe if Steam wasnt so greedy with thier publishers they wouldnt be in this mess! Everyone complaining are a bunch of commies, its Steam you should be pissed at!  

BTW, I love Borderlands II, its stupid fun with friends. Its simply got caught in the crossfire between fans, Steam and 2K.

review:
This game is pretty much Borderlands 2 but with a way worse story, the writing's not bad, there are actually some portions that I thought were amazingly well written. I personally couldn't finish the game because I kept getting bored, I was close to the end, but that part is just REALLY boring. The game is the worst of the 3 in most ways, the character balancing is good, so there aren't any characters like Gaige, which is a downside in my eyes.

Overall: THE GAME IS TOO BORING.

review:
Okay I've heard of all the bugs and I was gonna look past them anyways when I started playing, make a positive review since this was given to me for free.
However, I CAN'T EVEN PLAY THE GAME.
I click play, it says it's running then nothing, it just stops.
That is completely unacceptable, I had to actively go into the files and skip the launcher in order to play this game.

Additional (I'm going to add things as I play more:
The hats absolutely suck might as well not list it as a feature.
They haven't changed the sprint, if you sprint to the left while moving your camera to the right you cancel the sprint, if you move the camera too much while sprinting you cancel the sprint.
The graphics have improved.
Having the minimap is great.
When you buy ammo upgrades there's dialogue to confirm or cancel which fades away, it shouldn't be there.
Going through the menus (On mouse and keyboard) is a calamity.
Click melee button too fast on certain melee bonus weapons and melee rate is slowed.
Melee with the weapon as soon as you pull it out and it will do the cocking animation over and over.
Online is a shitshow full of glitches.
Random custom waypoints showing up for no reason.

I just want to comment on the release of this game a little. There was a lot of things wrong with the original that were improved upon the next games. We look past the flaws on the OG because it was something new and it was a product of it's time. This is officially a 2019 game, people should expect higher quality to match the time. It's been 10 years, it's unacceptable to release the same game with very little improvements to the base game. When I opened this game I was expecting Borderlands ENHANCED not PLUS, they added more shit than they improved. And you know what I didn't buy it so I'm fine but for people who don't I do not think it's worth 30$

review:
I will remove this review when BL3 comes out on Steam.

Reasons not to use Epic Store: 
1) They have terrible security (80 million accounts were exposed last week)
2) They have terrible customer service (just google it) 
3) Games are more expensive on Epic due to regional pricing 
4) You can't play games offline 
5) Limited social features 
6) No screenshots 
7) No controller support 
8) They broke EU laws (and still do) 
9) Scummy tactics (you had to tick a box to opt out of emails etc) 
10) They are partially owned by Tencent (a company that sells user data to the Chinese government)
11) No achievements 
12) No cloud saves 
13) No game forums (many people went to steam for subnautica support) 
14) Epic make you pay the transaction fee when purchasing games 
15)They are anti-consumer (They pay for exclusive rights to games to try and force you to use their store)
16) They can refuse refunds even if you meet the criteria 
17) No reviews 
18) No Linux support

I love you Gearbox, you haven't failed us in the past, and we get that its 2k. But stand up to them. Make it clear that you won't let an executive decision ruin a perfectly good game.

review: I may be alone with this, but I just didn't find this game nearly as fun as the first borderlands, the gameplay gets repetitive and there are a lot of quests that require long travel just to deliver various quest items to other characters (at least in the early game). Personally I found the repetitive nature of the early part of the game made it so exceedingly boring that I quit it after about 8 hours of gameplay. I also felt that the item drops were just more of the same after a point leading to not really many actual choices for different weapons and load outs. I feel like the game developers tried to capitalize upon their prior successes without actually making anything new. This game is basically the Call of Duty of looter shooters at this point.

I guess it was alright back in the day, but I'd really not recommend it anymore

review:
you probably already know this, but if you don't here is the gist of why this game is dogshit.

-god damnit you spend like 70% of your time outside of an oxygen rich environment, having to constantly monitor your O2 levels. that's just not fun, I promise you.

-the fuck happened to laser guns in bl1-2? where'd it go? where's the cryo element, wheres s&s, atlas etc. 

-side quests are both incredibly tedious *and* effectively mandatory due to the main story being both short and not exp rich enough to keep you at level for it, so i sure hope you like claptrap, because everyones fuckin claptrap.

tl;dr it does little more than take a big ol dump on the game and it's story and mechanically it's been oxygen deprived. 

do not buy, even for free.

review:
Quite honestly, this is the WORST "Triple A" FPS game I've ever played in my life.

The zero gravity gets old in 5 minutes, and I'm supposed to play an entire game like this?

Enemies fly around freely and shoot me from angles and spots I can't see quite often. As long as they have a couple pixels exposed, they can shoot at you. Nothing but Scavs hiding behind jagged rocks, which seem to respawn endlessly during boss fights.

I can't believe design decisions like this were made, but then I realized it was probably made by a bunch of Australian SJWs. Then the lack of good decision making starts to become clear.

I DEEPLY regret wasting the $10 I did on buying it, because I've now basically condoned this terrible game making, which shames me, and I've now lost 2 hours that I will NEVER get back again.

review: Personally I like to play games at 600 EDPI, or 4.5 degrees for every centimetre I move my mouse, but that isn't possible in any of the Borderlands games because of the distinct lack of sensitivity options. Like seriously, the lowest amount is almost ten times as much as I want it to be! The game is such a masterpiece but it is completely ruined by the lack of comfort I am forced to have by these horrible settings. Some love letter to PC gamers this was supposed to be, I wouldn't recommend playing this game at all if you have even a moderately low sensitivity. I originally played this franchise on my PS3 and my PS4, and I was having so much fun there, finishing at least one character of TVHM with DLC for each game, and it was amazing, but the ridiculously, unreasonably high sensitivity I am forced to endure on PC is just not worth it whatsoever. I recieved this product for free for owning the original Borderlands game that I bought a week prior.

review:
I was pretty excited to see this game in my library as I was just thinking about playing though the whole series again with my girlfriend. I tweaked the settings and booted up the game, got through the enormous EULA and started the game up and...it stutters. Horribly. I suffer through the introduction, skipping what I can and get into the settings and tweak it again. I manage to get rid of the stutter but it's still jerky with random framerate drops. 
There's no reason why a 10 year old game should run this poorly on a year old machine. Even with HD upgrades. I have no issues running any other HD game I try, but for some reason this one runs like garbage. I really appreciate the freebie, but I think it would have been better to just have kept it to yourself until it was done. I sure hope this isn't a sign of things to come.

review:

review:

But steam should have no right to remove review, this is just like rotten tomatoes, this is unacceptable. Steam is a platform for reviewing and sharing opinions, the fact that gearbox made a game that has been on steam for years exclusive is insane. People have a right to share their opinions on the topic. Theyve all paid for borderlands and played them over the years. There would not be a borderlands 3 if it wasn't for these people. That more then affords them this right. 

For steam to remove peoples voice... is absolutely deplorable. America was founded on the freedom to speak and to be heard. I am ashamed to have spend so much time and money on this platform now.

review:
If you like Borderlands you will like this game's gameplay, though the low grav can get tedious. That being said, the story is forgettable and the ham fisted sjw characters are so poorly written. If you're going to go out of your way to throw your personal politics into the game, at least don't just lecture and berate the players.

Right off the bat, within the tutorial, some poorly voiced, forgettable Aussie lesbo character says white men are homophobes and the first few quests are you killing "enemies" who said mean words to her. Not even joking, all they did was offend her. Even in imaginary fantasy worlds depicted in video games, progressives are fragile, pathetic excuses for human beings who are willing to hurt people because they said things.

UPDATE AFTER 10 HRS PLAYED

I couldn't even continue playing for the story. It was terrible. I wanted to play because I wanted to learn Jack's backstory and I loved BL and BL2. This game is trash. The zero gravity gets very boring, every character is very poorly voice acted, and the maps are very very very bland and uninteresting. Also, the writers were not as clever as they thought they were. They seemed very pleased with themselves with the names of enemies especially, but saying Kragon 45 miliion times won't make me appreciate it any more. If you love gay and gender politics being inserted into the game every chance they get, this game is for you. If you like Borderlands 2 this game may be playable for the story of Jack only. Otherwise, this game is utter garbage.

review:
It's a tough call between recommending this game or not. If this were a separate game on it's own, most people would probably have recommended it more readily. Inevitably, because this is another BL series, comparisons tend to be drawn against BL2 which is a far better and more complete game. 

If on sale, go for it though.

Pros: 
- Many different characters to try with good ability trees
- Add on to the story line
- More handsome jack

Cons:
- Lazy side quest designs, most of them are annoying fetch quests that adds no value
- Most annoying BL character - Pickle. If I could blow him up, I would.
- Unclear map objectives, mini maps, lack of fast travels to many locations
- Space jumping is not my cup of tea
- Inventory, shared stash and bank space.
- Less interesting and humorous conversations compared to BL2
review_bomb_reason: Ein paar Monate vor Release von Borderlands 3 wurde von Entwickler "Gearbox Software" und Publisher "2K" bekannt gegeben, dass Borderlands 3 eine Zeit lang exklusiv im neuen (und kontroversen) Epic Games Store angeboten werden würde, und nicht auf anderen Plattformen wie Steam. Deshalb erhielten ältere Teile der Borderlands - Serie auf Steam und Metacritic negative Reviews.

review:
If you have never played Borderlands, you can buy it, it's a good game.
But for an "enhanced" version, it's clear Gearbox did not test it. [spoiler]Like Duke Nukem World Tour[/spoiler] 

- Audio logs sometime suddenly stop.
- Reload animation on some SMG is broken.
- Menu to sell items on some shop does not show the weapon you want to sell, you have to use the arrow keys to make it works.
- Could have update the class mod system to be visible in the skill trees.
- Minimap randomly zoom in, and I have to press Esc to set the reset the zoom
- When I open the quest log and click on a quest, it places a map marker (not an objective marker)
- SpLiTsCrEeN iS tOo HaRd To PoRt FrOm CoNsOlE.

review:
If I had to pay for this I'd be pretty upset.

Had a group ready to play on launch only to find out the multiplayer is completely broken. Enemies will teleport around and bullets will take seconds to hit after firing. Even having push to talk your voice will sometimes transmit in lobby screens and in game
The map has a bug where a custom waypoint will be set when you open the menu.
I don't know what's wrong with the engine but I'm constantly getting stuck on random objects for a couple seconds. I noticed in the beginning that skags would randomly scale mountains after leaping towards you.
They said they buffed the last boss in the main game and it feels like nothing was changed. 
I'm seeing people say there's no 21:9 support.

For $30 this feels pretty terrible. Hopefully they fix multiplayer :c

review:
A free "Upgrade", however the online is HORRID, the only good thing being the..graphics..The old bugs are still in game + new ones:

Voice chat has to be deactivated trough the .ini cause the option to do it in the Settings...THOSE NOT WORK WHAT SO EVER. (Not to mention one of the reasons to cause lag in game...)

The Game lags like hell in certain areas, even tho i'm playing in the same internet as my brother

The game has performance issues that you need to edit the .ini again to fix the dumb sluter

You need to edit the ,INI YET AGAIN to have more then 60hz

The golden case was really not necessary but it's a neutral opinion on my side, it's not a bad thing, but also not really needed.

WHY THE HELL THOSE IT NOT HAVE A LAN MODE IS BEYOND ME.

AND HECK YOU CAN'T PLAY WITH YOU'R FRIEND IF THEY ARE NOT IN THE SAME DONE QUESTS AS YOU, OR ELSE THEY WON'T GET THE QUESTS YOU DO EXP,

And the newly added "Gearbox" Weapons are not special in anyway shape or form, they are standard weapons with the same skin, if anything they could be signed as Purple Rarity..not Legendary, as they are anything BUT Legendary..

SURE it was gifted..but i still rather play the old version as the new.."Graphics" are really the only thing good in this version... Everything else is just..disappointing overall.
JUST ANOTHER GEARBOX "GAME" AM I R8.
They can't even just simply...add 4k textures and a DECENT FOV OPTION (IT RESETS TO THE DEFAULT FOV WHEN YOU REVIVE SOMEONE, RUNNING FIXES IT BUT STILL) without making the game buggier.. not to mention removing the Lan option being "FANTASTIC" Altogether.

review: It's very repetitive in a way that previous games aren't. You'll go through some of the same areas over and over and over and over again that I found myself literally just running through them and avoiding combat because it just became really tiresome to kill the same enemies over and over and over again. In reality it should be a 20 hours game that's very clearly added grinding to pad out the length. It's more like DLC to Borderlands 2 than it's own game. It has few new features, same graphics as B2 and is very skippable.

also Claptastic Voyage DLC was surprisingly well done

if you ever find the courage to play it, invite another poor soul at your aid, as they say misery loves company

review: So comparably speaking this would be a passable game, however after putting several hours into this game, at the request of my brother, who loves it, I have found it atrocious. I do not like it. I was neigh invincible, then suddenly I just keep dying, over and over. This has a lot to do with bugs, but several times it had to do with reloading weapons while I was down and had to kill an enemy. WHY DOES IT TAKE SO LONG TO RELOAD??? I've never had that be a consistent reason for death in any game. Graphically not as amazing as Borderlands 2. Gameplay is inferior to every Borderlands so far. New additions are nice, such as class, however ultimately I had to give this a thumbs down, because I realized it was just a horrible sequel and I ultimately felt the time I spent on the game was a waste.

review:
NOT A REVIEW BOMBING!

Honesly i have never played borderlands before, and i wanted to give it a try with this one, cause of the new graphics and the FOV slider that is essential for me. But damn, the lag is incredible! my pc has all the requirements to run this smoothly but even in low graphics there is a frame drop that made me unistall instantly the title. I was told that in the first original the FOV slider is not present, and that i have to change it anytime i do actions that changes the camera mode via console command. Not checked for a permanent solution yet tbh, but it is still annoying and i'm not feeling to install it. So, yes i'm lazy, but you publisher better stand up from the couch and put some work on it, cause apparently i'm not the only one with these problems! If the problem get solved i'm going to rewrite an appropriate review for it.

Pros:
- adjustable FOV
- minimap
- better textures
- bit more customization
- auto pickup
- free because I own the original game
- not Epic Store exclusive (unlike BL3)

- the lowest graphic settings are still quite high
- doesn't support DX9
- glitchy cutscenes

review: best open world series of this kind . all three of them .
review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.

review: A very solid and addicting card game. It's not really pay to win as well, you will get the cards you want eventually as long as you keep progressing, opening free kegs and getting those daily rewards. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. Aber auch andere Spieler beteiligten sich am Review Bombing, da sie der Meinung waren, dass sich Spieleentwickler aus politischen Angelegenheiten heraushalten sollten.

review:
Overall they fixed a lot the main issues that plagued this game from the start. It's playable now and on a 3070 I can play the game maxed out with RTX also maxed out at 30 stable with DLSS on balanced. Overall an amazing game. The story is interesting and has a fun open world to explore. I will break this game down into two sections, Pros and Cons.

Pros:
- Amazing graphics 
- Amazing sound
- Great Story(I will touch on this in the con sections)
- Tons of cool weapons and great selection of ways to massacre your enemies
- Amazing Perk and Skill trees

Cons: 
- Ending feels kinda rushed
- Enemy factions don't have a role at all in free roam 
- Limited number of side missions that are fun
- Story is short only around 20 hours
- Cars feel more like tanks 
- Dialog for NCPs is limited
- No real end goal other than to beat story

Overall I would say get this game when it's on sale. I do hope they add some sort of DLC to the game to add more to the story as its kinda lack luster right now. But pretty fun game with a lot of potential.

review:
This is a hard one to review. The game is very unforgiving and explains very little; allied with the fact that your first weapons are incredibly imprecise, and you get a frustrating start.

But later, once you get nicer weapons and start to understand the game's systems, it becomes a lot of fun. Though your character does not "level up", the loot and quest systems make this feel a lot like a RPG. The game can still kill you quickly, but this is a minor drawback if you QuickSave/QuickLoad a lot. Moreover, the A.I. is quite varied (sometimes the enemies come looking for you, but often they patiently wait around a corner or behind cover; they often speak, but some of them are silent), which makes the fights exciting and tense.

The story is... weird. It reminds me of Indigo Prophecy, in the sense that some things happen that just seem randomly "grafted" into the plot for no good reason -- some story bits felt like they belonged to another post-apocalyptic game, with cutscenes disjointed from the gameplay bits. This is one of the few games where the "bad" endings are more interesting than the "true" ones.

Another technical complaint: someone has to tell developers (even the "Witcher 3" folks) that encumbrance in videogames is not fun! I get that it is unrealistic to lug around more than 60Kg while you are shooting, jumping and running, but walking miles just to stash your valuables is really boring.

But anyway, the star of the game is atmosphere -- outdoor scenes change from a breezy day to stormy and back, and some of the interiors are quite scary (X18 and X16 are awesome in that regard). The ticking of Geiger counters and anomaly proximity alerts can keep you on your toes, and reinforce the idea of "invisible dangers" all around you. It is really impressive how other stalkers walk around, fight monsters whether you are near or not, factions fight each other with or without your interference... This makes this dead world very lively, and, for me, this was the best aspect of the game.

Score: 81/100.

Notes: I played the game in "Stalker" difficulty, and used only one mod/patch, the "Zone Reclamation Project", in order to get rid of the nastiest bugs.

review: Does a good job at setting the scene for new Witcher fans; there are a lot of journal entries in the game that help with understanding the world and how it works. Mechanically the game mediocre at best, however the world building and story were interesting enough to keep me playing. I got the feeling that the Netflix series was true to this first game in many ways; meet Vessemir and you'll get what I mean. One of my favorite moments was when a simple innkeeper tells the story of a witcher princess sorceress as best he can, without remembering the names of the people involved. To this Geralt, who has no memory of his past, says "A witcher princess sorceress? Isn't that a bit much?".
review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. CD Projekt Red (CDPR), ihre Spiele nicht mehr mit Rubel bezahlt werden konnten, z.B. die “S.T.A.L.K.E.R.” - Serie, oder direkt Geld an die Ukraine spendeten (Entwickler von “This War of Mine” und “Frostpunk”). Dadurch fühlten sich vor allem russische Spieler hintergangen oder zu Unrecht bestraft. review:
The game started with a good intro to put you into the mood. the music is great, the writing is superb and the voice acting was top notch. The gameplay is incredibly fun as well with many possibilities and decks you could make (Havent played GWENT before didnt know I was missing out on this). 
Towards the end some puzzles get tedious and some fights a bit drawn out but overall the experience is still fun and immersive. Some game design choices though really held this game back but nothing too devastating, things such as the extreme slow movement on the map, The inability to save multiple files, I get the effect this has on making your choices feel irreversible and that they matter but it can backfire - this is specially bad because a misclick could ruin the entire immersion and my choice. I did forego some of those shortcomings, specially when I saw the hilarious and awesome easter eggs, if theres anything to encourage you to explore that would be the first thing on the list.

TLDR;

Pros: 
- Great Story
- Great Voice acting
- Fun gameplay

Cons:
- Slow movement and sometimes slow gameplay.
- No multiple saves.
- Some options dont say what is written.

review:
Doesn't feel very "witcher"-y.  Card game is just OK; it's very straightforward, and you don't get enough deck-building choices to get much joy out of that.  Majority of battles are literally puzzles, or feel like puzzles/gimmicks rather than "battles against an opponent".  I want a game where I explore around unlocking cards to build my weird gimmick deck; you don't get nearly enough cards or choices to do that.  You get to customize a set deck.  A little.

Quite often the puzzles hinge on poorly translated rules text - card or scenario mechanics that behave in ways that are undefined, or do not match the text you're given.

Story is boringly, hilariously grim-dark.  Oh, you saved a dog?  It's Hitler's dog and it's a spy and it bites a child and it's all your fault.  After 3 or 4 rounds of that it doesn't feel like a shocking betrayal, it just isn't anything.   Your choices aren't real or meaningful, you're just picking door 1 or door 2 - and behind each of them is another betrayal or dead friend or tortured peasant and none of it is written well enough for you to care.

review:
Well, I really like The Witcher, the story in both 1, 2 and 3 are wonderful, perfect scripts, captivating characters, a really amazing world well made and very adaptable to the game, but the gameplay sucks, even though the game is from 2007, I think CD Projekt didn't pay much attention to the gameplay, if you (gamers) can handle all the negativity of the gameplay you will have an amazing game to enjoy.

OK. But I'm writing this analysis and negatively because I can not accept this nonsense that is mixing politics with games (and before some assholes comes here try to tell me that the government receives taxes from the sale of games, do you really think these sales can sustain a government? i dont't think so, it's insignificant compared to what these NATO dogs buy, oil and gas). So CD Projekt, please explain to me, what is the meaning of these sanctions that will hit only gamers and perhaps their only escape valve, explains to me what is the point of prohibiting them from playing? virtual signaling? congratulations you have now, or do you expect a gamer revolution? are all gamers going to arm themselves and get Putin out of power? the stone in the road of the United States in its unceasing quest for global domination. You are part of this rotten Western media, in the next war caused by the "Savior of the World" United States, in a Middle Eastern country that no one cares about, because it's not Europe and there are no blonde people, I hope you establish sanctions too, in the same way that you are doing now, after all, if you sanction a country that caused a war, why not sanction all the other countries that cause wars? 

One thing I'm sure of, I'm never going to give you my money again. Because I don't know if I'm ever going to be sanctioned by you just for being born in my own country and take the blame for the acts of the world's rulers.

SHAME ON YOU CD PROJEKT!!

review:
the TL;DR: it's probably safe to buy now, maybe wait for a sale. great game with some flaws.

specs:
AMD ryzen 5 3600
16 gb ram
RX 570 8 gb
I feel it is important for this review to start off with my specs. I'm not running anything super high end, but definitely not low end either. For AMD cards it only works with driver 21.10.2 so if you're on something newer and don't want to rollback drivers skip this game until it works with current drivers.

I'll be honest I had never heard of this game until of it's shit show of a release so I had no hype for it. I had bought a physical copy of the witcher 3 on switch around 2018~2019 due to hearing all that CDPR had included and wanted to support that kind of pro customer move. that has been my extent with CDPR until now. 

After starting it on xbox due to the free trial I immediately fell in love with the world of cyberpunk 2077. Though that controller sucks for aiming and thankfully the PC version allows for mouse input while using a controller for amazing gyro aim compatibility.
graphically this game looks great and thanks to fidelityFX runs great. story wise it's really immersive and very well written.

as for glitches in my first ~12 hours I've ran into a couple minor graphical issues. people walking into a wall for less than a sec/ vibrating rubble. though it's never enough to pull me out of the experience and honestly the vibrating rubble at the end of act 1 fits very well an IMO helps sell the scene.
I've only experienced 1 crash and I didn't lose much progress.

review:
Thank you GSC Game World. Your games gave me an unforgettable experience, revived and destroyed the bad legacy of the Slavic Games and just made my childhood more fun.
I went through many of your games, including Cossacks and others. You gave me love for the atmosphere, not for the graphics.
I've been waiting for your game for 15 years, and received only a spit in the face. I do not support the war on the territory of Ukraine, but I would rather support the war than that those who bought your games, who appreciated and loved your games, waiting for your games, you just abandoned and lied. You lied about being out of politics and you/your games will not be affected by politics. I am very sorry that you have stooped to the level of such cheap and salable products. I'm not saying that the stalker game series that came out is bad, it's just the only thing I can do so that even Western players from America, Europe and others know what GSC Game World did for their fans. Ratings don't mean anything here. This game and all the rest of the legends, no estimates will dispute this.

review:
One of the most engaging and interesting RPG's I've ever played, and I didn't even get to make a custom character. The Witcher 3 stands proudly above all other RPGs and rightfully so. Its brooding dark setting are beset by its colorful cast of characters and wonderful writing which can range from fairly generic at times to downright tear jerking.

Gameplay - From a gameplay perspective The Witcher 3 uses a very well fleshed out system of combat, magic, and dialogue to let the player cultivate their own unique experience within Geralt's story. The combat ranges from button mashy when fighting crowds, to creative and visceral when facing boss and monster with out ever feeling grindy or unsatisfying. Geralt controls well and depending on your temperament can be quite suave and even hilarious at times. There are plethora of system available in the game as well which help to supplement the overall experience. Except Gwent... I hate Gwent.  Crafting and forging not only give you stronger equipment but potions and  charms which can give you advantages against the men and monsters of this world.

Story - The story ranges from basic rpg go here do x formula to down right engage story lines for even some of the small quests. I often found myself compelled to complete quest with stale gameplay just to see the story outcome they would have, and I'm happy to say most are worth doing! While the main story line grows stale from time to time side quests do a great job of keeping you engaged with the game enough that it never feels like a slough or choir to complete. Although it is probably best to take your time with this one, and make sure to buy the GOTY edition for the DLCs.

Probably the most fun I've had with an RPG since Mass Effect and Fallout New Vegas, The Witcher 3 strikes a cord deep with anyone looking to lose themselves and many hour of their time in it wonderous and brutal world!

Gameplay: 9 (Only reason this gets a 9 is bc of gwent, I hate gwent)
Story:9
Enjoyment:10
